channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped Christmas trees and timber, 23rd January
item.description:
Been there for weeks - just dumped all together

item.title: Flytipping, 23rd January
item.description:
This has been here for months and is rat infested. The council have told me that it is on private land but will not say who and because of the rats I was promised a call from environmental department which has still happened.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Groom Road, Broxbourne
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Fly tipping, 23rd January

item.title: Missing yellow lines, 23rd January
item.description:
A short section of double yellow lines is still missing on Mosslea Road near junction with Balfour Road near lampost 67M4. The lines need urgent re-instatement as vehicles parked there obscure the view for traffic pulling out of Balfour Road into Mosslea / Chatterton Road. As there is a valid TMO in place for this section of road, it is a maintenance issue rather than a new traffic scheme as claimed when previously reported last year (October). Either way, nothing has happened and requires attention asap.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mosslea Road, Southborough, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Dog fouling next to the tree in front of 21 Tremaine, 23rd January
item.description:
Dog fouling again next to the tree. I hope the council will come to remove the fouling away this time.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Tremaine Road, Anerley, Greater London

item.title: Car parked for over a week., 23rd January
item.description:
Vehicle GU57 GRX parked on Maiden Lane. Very unusual for a car to be there for that long and not see anyone come and go. It does have tax etc but a neighbour and I wonder if it has been stolen or abandoned.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): White Hill Road, Barnes Cray, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Blocked PSWS outlet, 23rd January
item.description:
Hi Thames water, Our service provider attended this location yesterday evening to cleans to the drainage assetts at this location and found that the assett reported was found to be surgcharging due to a blockage in the 300mm PSWS run as per the attached, can you please arrange for the PSWS to be cleansed so the drainage assetts can operate effectively. Thank you

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Homesdale Road, Widmore, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: This new pothole has appeared., 23rd January
item.description:

item.title: Pot hole in a bus stop, 23rd January
item.description:
